job description:
HVH Precision Analytics applies proprietary AI/machine learning techniques to the breadth of healthcare and non-healthcare data to provide a unique and unmatched suite of services and products to a broad range of industries. Our ability to develop and apply AI/machine learning algorithms to disparate datasets to deliver actionable results to our clients has launched HVH onto an accelerated growth path.

HVH is a joint venture between Perspecta (formerly Vencore and Lockheed Martin), which has offerings in mission services, digital transformation and enterprise operations for U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets, and Havas Health & You (part of Havas Group), a global strategic communications partner to many top biopharma companies.

We are seeking highly motivated individuals who are passionate about novel database constructs, AI/machine learning, and its application across a variety of industries to join our Analytics Team and help our clients gain actionable insights not previously possible.

Job Title: Data Architect / Data Scientist

Job Description:

This position is a combination of developing advanced data schemas that leverage advanced database concepts and integrating them with novel AI/machine learning techniques. In addition, this individual will be responsible for developing the corporate global data strategies, initiating and maintaining global data supplier relationships and for internal data management and governance.

Job Requirements:
  • Develop and design novel high performance data architectures leveraging SQL and NoSQL database technologies (e.g., RDMS, ORDBMS, graph databases, etc.)
  • High level of proficiency and expertise on AWS, Azure, and Google cloud platforms
  • Ability to initiate, evaluate and maintain relationships with global data suppliers
  • Develop ongoing corporate global data acquisition and management strategies
  • Develop, document and maintain data management strategies and policies
  • Apply data mining and machine learning techniques and models to extract analytic insights from terabyte and larger size data sets
  • Develop visualizations for delivery to clients
  • Develop software solutions using Python, R, or Julia
  • Interface with other HVH analysts and with program managers and HVH customers
  • Respond to additional ad-hoc analysis requests
Required Skills

The skills required for this position are listed below:
  • Degree in any of the following majors: Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Physics
  • Minimum 3 years experience, with a BS/MS degree in one of the above listed majors
  • Works independently and is a self-starter
  • Client interface and presentation skills
  • Proficiency in the following programming languages, analysis tools, and skills:
  • SQL programming
  • AWS, Azure, and Google cloud platforms
  • Python (pandas, scikit-learn, Numpy, Scipy, and database access packages)
  • SQL / NoSQL database experience (MySQL, Redshift, etc.)
*
  • Powerpoint: presentation development skills
  • Linux (Red Hat, CentOS); Python and software development in a Linux environment * Consideration will be given to prior publications, independent software projects completed, and non-proprietary code authored by the candidate
Job Type: Full-time

Experience:
  • AI: 3 years (Required)
  • Google Cloud Platform: 3 years (Required)
  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux: 3 years (Required)
  • R: 3 years (Required)
  • Data Mining: 3 years (Required)
